YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

York archaeologist narrowly avoids Nepal earthquake by just two hours

Dr Hayley Saul and her sister are now fundraising to help survivors of the Langtang earthquake

New campaign set to tackle sexual assault

Videos highlighting the 'singular abnormality' of sexual assault and harassment will be filmed as part of the campaign

York shortlisted for best university in the north

The winners of the new Educate North Awards will be announced on 3 June at a dinner in Manchester

York ranked 17th in Complete University Guide league table

Sam Maguire, YUSU President, called the new league tables a 'real mixed bag'

Universities see increase in donations

A combined total of PS807m was raised by universities during 2013/2014

URY wins I Love Student Radio Award

URY's Freshers 2014 broadcasts won the award for Best Audience Initiative

Constantine College vote of no confidence successful at committee stage

Constantine College Student Association has successfully passed a vote of no confidence against Usman Khan

Campus nightclub plans shelved

Jon Greenwood, Director of Commercial Services, said the University 'cannot afford to all the work' needed for the nightclub at the moment

Frustration over introduction of new healthcare costs for non-EU students

The Immigration Health Surcharge was introduced despite concerns being raised by the House of Lords

Liberation groups across Yorkshire come together to form new network

The Yorkshire Equality and Diversity Network plans to run collaborative campaign addressing issues such as domestic violence and consent

Paralympian to speak at DSN event

'Access Your Future' is the Disabled Students Network's flagship event and will take place in June

NUS' 'Liar Liar' campaign comes under fire for being politically biased

The campaign has been criticised for being politically biased in favour of the Labour Party and not being a good use of the NUS' money

Horsing around

A University official warned students not to approach unfamiliar animals after two incidents involving horses resulted in students receiving minor injuries

University vows to reduce cost of sanitary products

Izzy Lomas, President of Feminist Society, called the decision 'encouraging'

Student calls for letting agencies to alter 'problematic' gender questions

A petition has been set up asking student letting agencies to remove gender specifications on letting forms or add a third option

Women's Officer calls online abuse during NUS conference 'harmful'

A clapping ban implemented during the Women's Conference was mocked online

New survey lists York as one of the unsafest places to be a student

The rankings were based on the number of recorded crimes per thousand residents

Plans to turn pub into drop-in centre for recovering addicts

The charity Changing Lives had their offer for The Melbourne accepted in March

Survey suggests Green Party will have the most support from York students

Survey shows considerable financial struggles of students

Just under 74 per cent of students who responded to the survey believe their maintenance loan is not enough to live on

University seeks recognition for representation of women in science

The University's decision to apply for renewal of its Athena SWAN status has been met with scepticism from students

Campus laundry service cleans up its act

The washing machines will now be cleaned daily instead of once a week

Chaos at James College Pride Night

A student set off the fire alarm in response to a drag act who was deemed to be offensive by several people

York comes top ten for teaching in THE Student Experience Survey

The University of York came joint 22nd for overall student experience

Online campaigning begins for referendum on boycott of goods from illegal Israeli settlements

Voting will open in the second week of term on Tuesday 21 April

Constantine coup d'etat launched

The coup, which is being lead by the FCC, want to establish a shop on Heslington East

Constantine president temporarily suspended by vote of no confidence

Constantine students asked to support vote of no confidence against President

Usman Khan, President of Constantine College, said the call for a vote of no confidence was 'surprising'

Man arrested on suspicion of murder by Claudia Lawrence police

Lawrence worked at the University of York prior to her disappearance in 2009

YUSU announces referendum on Living Wage to be held in Week 10

A University official recently confirmed the University would be unlikely to apply for Living Wage accreditation
